description: DyND is a library for dynamic, multidimensional arrays, targeting Python and C++ as initial first-class targets. Representing dynamic function calls is one of its cornerstones, and is a part of the library which has gone through many variations to converge on a design. In this talk, we will cover both the high level and low level details of the DyND callable, the object which encapsulates function calls.
title: DyND Callables
